documentation.text:
the landlord can close the channel at any time by presenting a
 agreed upon amount from the tenant. the landlord will be sent that amount,
 and the remainder will go back to the tenant.
 This is helpful if the tenant leaves in the middle of a month and the landlord 
 agrees to prorate the rent for the month.

the tenant can extend the expiration at any time
 the landlord can offer the tenant an extension on rent if the tenant cannot pay on time
 and provides the landlord with a understandable explanation such as loss of job due to pandemic
 for instance NY State allowed tenants to pay their rent many months behind schedule 
 without the threat of eviction as a result of the COVID-19 Pandemic.

if the timeout is reached without the landlord closing the channel,
 then the ComputeCoin is released back to the tenant.

attributes.text:
the landlord can close the channel at any time by presenting a
 agreed upon amount from the tenant. the landlord will be sent that amount,
 and the remainder will go back to the tenant.
 This is helpful if the tenant leaves in the middle of a month and the landlord 
 agrees to prorate the rent for the month.

the tenant can extend the expiration at any time
 the landlord can offer the tenant an extension on rent if the tenant cannot pay on time
 and provides the landlord with a understandable explanation such as loss of job due to pandemic
 for instance NY State allowed tenants to pay their rent many months behind schedule 
 without the threat of eviction as a result of the COVID-19 Pandemic.

if the timeout is reached without the landlord closing the channel,
 then the ComputeCoin is released back to the tenant.

claimTimeout().notice: if the timeout is reached without the landlord closing the channel, then the ComputeCoin is released back to the tenant.

extend(uint256).notice: the tenant can extend the expiration at any time the landlord can offer the tenant an extension on rent if the tenant cannot pay on time and provides the landlord with a understandable explanation such as loss of job due to pandemic for instance NY State allowed tenants to pay their rent many months behind schedule  without the threat of eviction as a result of the COVID-19 Pandemic.

payRent(uint256).notice: the landlord can close the channel at any time by presenting a agreed upon amount from the tenant. the landlord will be sent that amount, and the remainder will go back to the tenant. This is helpful if the tenant leaves in the middle of a month and the landlord  agrees to prorate the rent for the month.
